Director of Software

Full-time Position • Redwood City, CA

Apply Now

Mayfield Robotics is a startup working on creating an adorable home robot. Our team is small and growing quickly. We are wholly owned by a large company but are operating independently. We are similar to typical startups in terms of speed and growth but are free of the distraction of fundraising. The atmosphere around the office is energetic, casual, and nerdy. We like to build robots and stay close to our customers. Our office is located in Redwood City near Caltrain and right off 101.

Role

We are looking for a Director of Software to lead our team of mobile, cloud backend, embedded Linux, and robotics engineers. Managing the team and riding herd over the diverse array of technical challenges will never be boring.

The tech side: You will lead our efforts to develop production-quality code that runs on the robot as well as the cloud. Generalists will thrive in this role. We are looking for a leader who understands how firmware, high level algorithms, web infrastructure, and mobile apps come together to create a complete product. As we move to production and rollout, you will help us scale the technical infrastructure to be ready for tens of thousands of robots rapidly coming online.

The people side: We work in a dynamic environment and are working to successfully deliver a home robot to consumers under tight deadlines and cost constraints. The crucial challenge will be balancing your enthusiasm for rolling up your sleeves and solving day-to-day issues with a longer, more broad product and company perspective.

Responsibilities

  • Directly manage our growing software team of 5-10 people
  • Assess engineering team needs, build, and execute on a hiring plan
  • Be responsible for project management (both schedule and staff assignments) and meeting of milestone goals
  • Oversee the architecture and development of a scalable software system, including cloud backend and an ARM embedded Linux firmware system that requires over the air updates
  • Research, recommend, and implement new tools, techniques, and engineering best practices and procedures
  • Develop, train, and mentor software engineering staff
  • Drive development processes to meet aggressive release schedules
  • Review and contribute to code, design, and architecture decisions with team and propose changes and improvements to promote scalable, reliable, and maintainable technologies

Qualifications

  • 10+ years of experience in the development and shipping of production quality software
  • Experience building cohesive teams including: sourcing, recruiting, interviewing, and closing exceptional engineers.
  • Experience leading engineering teams including building long-term product roadmaps, team member tasking, performance management, and career development of staff
  • Strong communication and analytical skills
  • Proven track record of delivering projects, hands-on with writing code and understanding technologies
  • BS or MS degree in Engineering or Computer Science or equivalent work experience
  • Experience with products that combine hardware and software, or that involved substantial video streaming and analytics
  • Comfortable with Agile development methodologies, cloud/mobile development, and embedded development
  • Experience with APIs and RESTful services
  • Experience with the broad ecosystem of frameworks and tools that enable web frontend development (such as jQuery, React, AngularJS, Backbone, or Ember)
  • Experience with development tools such as AWS, Vagrant, Docker, and Ansible

Nice-to-haves

  • Familiarity with statistical robotics, machine vision, or machine learning algorithms
  • Familiarity with ROS
  • Experience with embedded Linux software development and ARM processors, low-level driver development, and performance optimization
  • Experience with Python, JavaScript, C++ programming
  • Experience with iOS and Android app development
  • Experience with robotics projects

Benefits

  • Medical/Dental/Vision
  • 20+ company holidays in addition to vacation and sick leave
  • Catered lunches
  • Free gym membership (Crunch gym right next door)
  • Caltrain passes
  • 401K

How to Apply

To apply, send your resume to jobs+directorofsoftware@mayfieldrobotics.com.

Apply Now
